bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The RPA also publishes the journal Radical Philosophy Review.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal Radical Philosophy Review, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: Select financial documents, mostly from conference registration, were appraised and destroyed, based on the presence of sensitive personal information and a relative lack of evidential, intrinsic, or informational value.
